intro: Hoya batutikarensis, commonly known as the Batutikarensis Waffle Plant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in low-light conditions, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its unique waxy texture and attractive foliage make it a visually appealing addition to any collection. The flowers typically bloom in shades of white and pink, adding a delicate touch to its appearance.
